title: Searching for Information in Software Development Projects Using the Alert System

author: Luka Stopar, Artificial Intelligence Laboratory, Jožef Stefan Institute

segmentation: Hi, my name is Luca.
Now present the alert project alert is short for active support and real time coordination based on event processing influence development flow stands for Free Libre open source software.
OK, Open source developers are located all over the world or so they need different communication channels to interact with each other.
So to exchange information on bug reports they have.
On systems like monkeys, bugzilla, launchpad.
Or
I use source code management systems for code commits and for describing changes.
Mailing lists are used for open discussions, and wikis are used as platforms for providing user support.
Um so.
In order to.
Look deep into an issue or something like that.
The user has to open many tabs and use different search interfaces.
Cause problems.
So.
The alert system integral integrates all of the previously mentioned information sources.
We monitor code tracking system, source code management systems, forums, mailing lists and weakness.
We extract information from structured and unstructured sources and provide an advanced search capabilities.
Trust all these sources.
We provide automatic methods for things like finding duplicate bugs, bugs.
And suggesting issues for a developer and provides subscription mechanisms so that the user can be notified when something relevant to him happen.
This is the basic architecture of the system.
Here on top we have sensors which send information to two knowledge extractors.
One is from structured sources and from unstructured sources.
This one is able to extract method names and such things from commits.
And the other one is able to extract entities from pure text.
They both store the information in a knowledge base.
Then we have three services who pass that information to the user.
First is the recommendation service.
This one keeps profiles of all the users.
And is able to suggest a developer who can fix an issue or an issue which might be appropriate for some developer.
The event detector lets the users subscribe to particular topics so that if they would only like to hear about Bluetooth they will only be notified about Bluetooth.
And the search and visualization service offers an interface for searching and visualizes results.
So as the search service, it provides the ability to search across multiple information sources.
Now first for conceptually different search options.
The first is general search.
Here the user can enter plain keywords in the top text field and the matched results will be shown.
They can also choose whether they would like to sort by date or by relevance here on the bottom text box they can enter people and only posts and mails related to those people will be shown.
They can filter by information source and by that.

The.
2nd is duplicate issue detection.
Here the user enters an idea of an issue and then at least is displayed ranked by similarity.
The similarity is also displayed so then they can see what this issue is.
I don't know 70% the same and they can take a look at them and determine if it's in fact the duplicates.

The user may search for issues they may have cost.
The last one is suggest issues for a developer.
Here the user can enter name of person and then some issues that they might be able to fix are displayed.
The system visualizes the results in five different ways.
